summary: The 'Funding Small Businesses During Shutdown Act' (H.R. 5568) aims to ensure continued funding for certain Small Business Administration (SBA) programs during a government shutdown in Fiscal Year 2026. Specifically, it appropriates funds to service various SBA loan programs, including those under Section 7(m) and 7(a) of the Small Business Act, and Title V of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958, along with administrative expenses. The bill's intent is to prevent the disruption of crucial financial services for small businesses during periods of government inaction.
